answers.answer: some cause can be:prostate enlargmentneurologic illness, MS, diabetes, strokeUTIHypertensionDiabetesHardening of the arteries and other vascular disorders that interfere with the flow of blood to the penis and the mechanism of erectionHigh cholesterolTrauma, including injuries to the pelvis or spinal cordCertain types of surgery and radiation therapyMultiple sclerosis and other nervous system disordersDepressionHabits that worsen vascular disorders (e.g., abusing alcohol or smoking)Id recommend seeing a urologist and discussing the issue.  It is not as rare as you may think...read alot of posts here, they are about Erectile Dysfunction.  Best of Luck to you.

question: I am a 22 year old male, and a few nights ago I noticed I completely lost my ability to get an errection. I havnt recieved an errection since then. I also get some drips urine discharge frequently. I did some online research to see possible causes, and nothing seems to be matching my problem. I dont have the systems for diabetes, test cancer, cancer of the penis. I am getting more concerned about it. Does anyone have an advice on what possibly causing the problem?
title: Loss of erection
